refnamediv.refpurpose: C interface macro which checks the number of input parameters present in the calling Scilab function.

listitem.para: the minimum number of input parameters which must be present in the calling Scilab function
the maximum number of input parameters which must be present in the calling Scilab function

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: C interface macro which checks the number of input parameters present in the calling Scilab function. You must include stack-c.h to benefit from this function. If the number of input parameters is not between nb_min_params and nb_max_params, we quit the C interface and an error is returned in the Scilab console.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.para: In this example, the C interface function checks for a number of input parameters which must be between 2 and 3.
Now, some functions testing this interface:
refsection.programlisting: mycheckrhs(A,B); // OK, 2 output parameters mycheckrhs(A,B,C); // OK, 3 output parameters mycheckrhs(A); // ERROR, 1 output parameter mycheckrhs(A,B,C,D); // ERROR, 4 output parameters
